ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Assessment type
Notes: 1=TADS GATE A; 2=TADS GATE B; 3 = TADS Gate C; 4 = TADS Week 6; 5 = TADS Week 12; 6 = TADS Week 18; 7 = TADS Week 24; 8 = TADS Week 30; 9 = TADS Week 36; 10 = TADS F/U Mo 3; 11 = TADS F/U Mo 6; 12 = TADS F/U Mo 9; 13 = TADS F/U Mo 12; 14 = SOFTAD month 6; 15 = SOFTAD month 12; 16 = SOFTAD month 18; 17 = SOFTAD month 24; 18 = SOFTAD month 30; 19 = SOFTAD month 36; 20 = SOFTAD month 42

ElementDescription: Study stage
Notes: 0 = Pre-Randomization (TADS) 1 = Stage 1 (TADS) 2 = Stage 2 (TADS) 3 = Stage 3 (TADS) 4 = Stage 4 (TADS) 5 = Stage 5 (SOFTAD); 51=Treatmentas Usual; 52=Screening Alone; 53=Intervention; 67=Unknown; -888=Not Applicable; -999=Missing;

ElementDescription: Weeks from Time 0/baseline to assessment
Relationship of respondent to individual
Notes: 1 = Biological mom; 2 = Biological dad; 3 = Grandparent; 4 = Special education (sped) teacher; 5 = General education teacher; 6 = Occupational therapist; 7 = Speech and language therapist; 8 = Behavioral therapist; ElementDescription: Economic Burden: Expenses
Notes: 0 = No expenses; 1 = Expenses but affordable; 2 = Expenses causing effects onother areas of family budget

ElementDescription: Economic Burden: Impact of expenses
Notes: 1 = Using savings; 2 = Necessitate cutting back on other expenditures 3;  = Necessitate working additional hours/job

ElementDescription: Economic Burden: Debts
Notes: 2 = Incurred debts but envision no serious problems with payback; 3 = Incurred debts and envision will have problems with payback

ElementDescription: Economic Burden: Parent #1 loss of income
Notes: 0 = No income lost; 2 = Time lost at work or hours reduced; 3 = Unable to work or lost job

ElementDescription: Economic Burden: Parent #2 loss of income
Notes: 0 = No income lost; 2 = Time lost at work or hours reduced; 3 = Unable to work or lost job

ElementDescription: Economic Burden: Child/adolescent loss of income
Notes: 0 = No income lost; 2 = Time lost at work or hours reduced; 3 = Unable to work or lost job

ElementDescription: Economic Burden: Other family member loss of income
Notes: 0 = No income lost; 2 = Time lost at work or hours reduced; 3 = Unable to work or lost job

ElementDescription: Time Lost From Work over the last 3 months: Has the respondent lost time from work
Notes: 0 = No; 2 = Yes

ElementDescription: Time Lost From Work over the last 3 months: Hours portion of time respondent lost from work
Time Lost From Work over the last 3 months: Minutes portion of time respondent lost from work
Time Lost From Work over the last 3 months: Hours portion of time respondent lost from work due to this study
Time Lost From Work over the last 3 months: Minutes portion of time respondent lost from work due to this study
Time Lost From Work By Another Adult Family Member over the last 3 months: Has another adult family member lost time from work
Notes: 0 = No; 2 = Yes

ElementDescription: Time Lost From Work By Another Adult Family Member over the last 3 months: Hours portion of time another adult family member lost from work
Time Lost From Work By Another Adult Family Member over the last 3 months: Minutes portion of time another adult family member lost from work
Time Lost From Work By Another Adult Family Member over the last 3 months: Hours portion of time another adult family member lost from work due to this study
Time Lost From Work By Another Adult Family Member over the last 3 months: Minutes portion of time another adult family member lost from work due to this study
Time Lost From Work By Another Adult Family Member over the last 3 months: Another adult family member rate of pay (dollars & cents)
Time Lost From Work By Another Adult Family Member over the last 3 months: Units of time for wages (another adult family member)
Notes: 1 = Year; 2 = Month; 3 = Two weeks; 4 = Week; 5 = Day; 6 = Hour; 7 = Other

ElementDescription: Time Lost From Work By Another Adult Family Member over the last 3 months: Hours portion of time worked in a typical week (another adult family member)
Time Lost From Work By Another Adult Family Member over the last 3 months: Minutes portion of time worked in a typical week (another adult family member)
Time Lost From Work By Another Adult Family Member over the last 3 months: Type of job (another adult family member)
Notes: 2 = Full-time; 3 = Part-time

ElementDescription: Time Lost From School over the last 3 months: Was time lost from school
Notes: 0 = No; 2 = Yes

ElementDescription: Time Lost From School over the last 3 months: Number of school days lost
Impact on Family Relationships: Negative/neutral impact on current relationship
Notes: 0 = No negative effects; 1 = Some negative effects butrelationship essentially satisfactory; 2 = Severe negative effects on quality of relationship attributed to child's problems; 3 = Child's problems contributed to marital breakdown

ElementDescription: Impact on Family Relationships: Positive impact on current relationship
Notes: 0 = No positive effects; 2 = Relationship has beenstrengthened

ElementDescription: Impact on Parent's Previous Partnership: Negative/neutral impact on breakdown of previous partnership
Notes: 0 = No negative effect; 1 = Some negative effects but breakdown of marital relationship not influenced by child's problems; 2 = Child's problems seen ascontributing to breakdown of marital relationship; 3 = Child's problems seen as most important reason for breakdown of marital relationship

ElementDescription: Impact on Parent's Previous Partnership: Negative/neutral impact on current relationship with previous partner
Notes: 0 = No negative effect; 1 = Some negative effects but quality of current relationship not influenced by child's problems; 2 = Child's problems seen as contributing to difficulties in current relationship; 3 = Child's problems seen as most important reason for difficulties in current relationship

ElementDescription: Impact on Parent's Non-Residential Boyfriend/Girlfriend: Negative/neutral impact on current relationship (non-residential)
Notes: 0 = No negative effects; 1 = Some negative effects but relationship is essentially satisfactory; 2 = Severe negative effects on quality of relationship attributed to the child's problems; 3 = Child's problems contributed to breakdown of relationship

ElementDescription: Impact on Parent's Non-Residential Boyfriend/Girlfriend: Positive impact on current relationship (non-residential)
Notes: 0 = No positive effects; 2 = Relationship has been strengthened

ElementDescription: Impact on parent's relationship with other children
Notes: 0 = Neutral or positive effect; 2 = Subject child's problems leave parent less time for other children but relationships not otherwise affected; 3 = Subject child's problems have led to a worsening of the relationship between parent and other children

ElementDescription: Impact on relationship between other children
Notes: 0 = Neutral or positive effect on relationship; 2 = Subject child's problems have led to some conflicts between children; 3 = Subject child's problems have led to major disruption of previous relationship

ElementDescription: Impact on other children's behavior
Notes: 0 = Neutral or positive effect on other children's behavior; 2 = Subject child's problems have led other children to have some behavior problems and to get into trouble at home; 3 = Subject child's problems have led other children to have some behavior problems and to get into trouble at school or elsewhere

ElementDescription: Impact on Other Relationships: Relationships with other family members
Notes: 0 = Positive or neutral effect; 1 = Some negative effects but relationships essentially unchanged; 2 = Worsening of relationships attributable to the child's problems; 3 = Child's problems have resulted in breakdown of relationships

ElementDescription: Impact on Other Relationships: Relationships with friends
Notes: 0 = Positive or neutral effect; 1 = Some negative effects but relationships essentially unchanged; 2 = Worsening of relationships attributable to the child's problems; 3 = Child's problems have resulted in breakdown of relationships

ElementDescription: Restrictions on Activities: Restricted personal activities
Notes: 0 = Little effect on personal activities; 2 = Some disruption of personal leisure activities due to child's problems, such as cutting down on activities and hobbies; 3 = Most or all personal leisure activities restricted or disrupted because of child's problems

ElementDescription: Restrictions on Activities: Restricted social activities for family
Notes: 0 = No effect on family's social life; 2 = Some disruption such as family cannot go some places because of child's problems; 3 = Most or all social activities restricted or disrupted because of child's problems

ElementDescription: Restrictions on Activities: Stigma
Notes: 0 = No stigma perceived; 1 = Embarrassed but does not feel disapproval or blame directed at him/herself; 2 = Parent feels stigmatized in the eyes of at least some people; 3 = Parent feels stigmatized by almost anyone who knows about child's problems

ElementDescription: Attribution for cause of problems: genetics
Notes: 1 = vague or indefinite attribution; 2 = partially responsible for child's problems; 3    = completely or almost completely responsible for child's problems

ElementDescription: Attribution for cause of problems: physical injury/disability
Notes: 1 = vague or indefinite attribution; 2 = partially responsible for child's problems 3;    = completely or almost completely responsible for child's problems

ElementDescription: Attribution for cause of problems: previous traumatic experience
Notes: 1 = vague or indefinite attribution; 2 = partially responsible for child's problems 3;    = completely or almost completely responsible for child's problems

ElementDescription: Attribution for cause of problems: child
Notes: 1 = vague or indefinite attribution; 2 = partially responsible for child's problems 3;    = completely or almost completely responsible for child's problems

ElementDescription: Attribution for cause of problems: self
Notes: 1 = vague or indefinite attribution; 2 = partially responsible for child's problems 3;    = completely or almost completely responsible for child's problems

ElementDescription: Attribution for cause of problems: partner
Notes: 1 = vague or indefinite attribution; 2 = partially responsible for child's problems 3;    = completely or almost completely responsible for child's problems

ElementDescription: Attribution for cause of problems: child's other parent
Notes: 1 = vague or indefinite attribution; 2 = partially responsible for child's problems 3;    = completely or almost completely responsible for child's problems

ElementDescription: Attribution for cause of problems: other family member
Notes: 1 = vague or indefinite attribution; 2 = partially responsible for child's problems 3;    = completely or almost completely responsible for child's problems

ElementDescription: Attribution for cause of problems: child's friends/peers
Notes: 1 = vague or indefinite attribution; 2 = partially responsible for child's problems 3;    = completely or almost completely responsible for child's problems

ElementDescription: Attribution for cause of problems: school
Notes: 1 = vague or indefinite attribution; 2 = partially responsible for child's problems 3;    = completely or almost completely responsible for child's problems

ElementDescription: Attribution for cause of problems: neighborhood/community
Notes: 1 = vague or indefinite attribution; 2 = partially responsible for child's problems 3;    = completely or almost completely responsible for child's problems

ElementDescription: Attribution for cause of problems: chance/bad luck
Notes: 1 = vague or indefinite attribution; 2 = partially responsible for child's problems 3;    = completely or almost completely responsible for child's problems

ElementDescription: Attribution for cause of problems: God's will
Notes: 1 = vague or indefinite attribution; 2 = partially responsible for child's problems 3;    = completely or almost completely responsible for child's problems

ElementDescription: Attribution for cause of problems: Satan
Notes: 1 = vague or indefinite attribution; 2 = partially responsible for child's problems 3;    = completely or almost completely responsible for child's problems

ElementDescription: Attribution for cause of problems: Other
Notes: 1 = vague or indefinite attribution; 2 = partially responsible for child's problems 3;    = completely or almost completely responsible for child's problems

ElementDescription: Psychological adjustment: Depression
Notes: 0 = No increase in depressive feelings attributed to child's problems; 2 = Yes some depression related to child's condition; 3 = Depression related to child's condition affecting ability to function normally

ElementDescription: Psychological adjustment: Worries
Notes: 0 = No increase in worries attributed to child's problems; 2 = Yes some worries related to child's condition; 3 = Worries affecting ability to function normally

ElementDescription: Psychological adjustment: Tiredness or anergia
Notes: 0 = No tiredness attributed to child's problems; 2 = Yes some tiredness related to child's condition; 3     = Tiredness affecting ability to function normally

ElementDescription: Psychological adjustment: Irritability
Notes: 0 = No irritability attributed to child's problems; 2 = Yes some irritability related tochild's problems; 3   = Irritability affecting ability to function normally

ElementDescription: Psychological adjustment: Other mental health problems
Notes: 0 = No other mental health problems attributed to child's problems; 2 = Yes other mental health problems related to child's condition; 3 = Other mental health problemsaffecting ability to function normally

ElementDescription: Psychological adjustment: Other physical health problems
Notes: 0 = No other physical health problems attributed to child's problems; 2 = Yes other physical health problems related to child's condition; 3 = Other physical health problems affecting ability to function normally

ElementDescription: Psychological adjustment: Medication
Notes: 0 = No medication for parent's problems related to child's condition; 2 = Medication being taken

ElementDescription: Psychological adjustment: Substance use
Notes: 0 = No increase or change in pattern of usage because of child's problems; 2 = Child's problems have led to increase in usage of alcohol and/or drugs

ElementDescription: Psychological adjustment: Support network
Notes: 0 = Family and/or friends have been of assistance to parent in dealing with the stress of the problem; 2 = Limited assistance; 3 = No assistance; 4 = Parent has not sought help

ElementDescription: Psychological adjustment: Professional help
Notes: 0 = No help sought; 2 = Parent has sought help from a professional for own problems related to child's condition

ElementDescription: Psychological adjustment: Feelings of competence
Notes: 2 = Feels some doubts about own ability to handle all or most child's problems adequately; 3 = Feels incompetent to deal with all or most of child's problems

ElementDescription: Respondent details
